Reviews.Title: Solid latest generation "point and shoot"
Reviews.Author: Kilgore Gagarin "Those who believe in telekin...
Reviews.Content: I am an end user and not a photographer and have purchased half a dozen "point and shoot" digital cameras over the years.ProsSmall and light, very portableExcellent in IA (intelligent automatic) mode - ISO and shutter speed displayedEasy to use without reading the manual (but read it anyway  - eventually)Nice, clear LCD displayHD video is OUTSTANDING (audio, not so much)Very good macro (close up) camera with flash off (my preference)ConsFlash is only good to about 2 metersDelay between pictures is "acceptable" but not excellentCamera audio speaker close to worthless"Burst" feature  (constant shooting while holding shutter button) is poorUPDATE 22 MAY 2012 (a year after acquisition): Durability is excellent. For the last  year I've been constantly letting this rattle around in my pocket. Works just as good as when it was new over a year ago. It has some wear marks (what you'd expect) but has physically held up perfectly.UPDATE 24 JUNE 2013 (2 years+ after acquisition): Still going strong. I still carry this constantly. At one point, some spots started appearing and I thought the sensor array had some dead pixels. Nope. Just used a can of air to blow on the lens and it's back to working as new. VERY durable product. I can't stress that I haven't babied this camera.ORIGINAL REVIEW:First thing I do with something like this is take it out of the box and start playing with it without reading the manual - not something I recommend, but working with a product starting in total ignorance tells you something about the overall device that gets spoiled once you learn how it is supposed to work. After playing with it in ignorance, I then read the enclosed printed manual from cover to cover. NOTE: The included CD-ROM includes a much more extensive, forty-two pages, manual that goes into greater technical detail about this camera.It was trivial to charge the included battery and it took a little less than the two hours advertised to do so. The Panasonic DMC-S1 is a very small, palm sized "point and shoot" that nestled easily in my front shirt pocket which was full of other junk as well. The actual camera is very light.I popped in the charged battery and a 4 GB Class 4 SD card (easy to do without reading the manual since both can only fit in the correct manner), pressed the power on, and started shooting everything in sight using the default IA (intelligent auto) mode. You will have to get an SD card since the on-board memory is only good for about 4 pictures at the highest (4000 x 3000 pixels) setting.The first twenty pictures I took were pretty solid with one or two slightly washed out with the automatic flash. The delay between pictures was acceptable (2-3 seconds) but not exceptional by any means. In IA mode, holding down the shutter button half way displays the ISO and shutter speed on the LCD display, which with my limited photographic experience was still a nice feature.Part of what I attempt to do is intentionally "stupid" things to see what happens (no, I do not immerse it in water). So, I turned the house lights out and started shooting people across the room. I didn't expect these low light photos to come out well, and they didn't - the camera detected the low light and that it needed the flash, but the range of the flash didn't do much to illuminate beyond the specified 2 meters or so, hence, the picture was blurry. Otherwise, walking around the house, outside the house, up to people real close, etc., I'd say 90 percent of the 150 or so pictures I took were very good to excellent (and a little post processing won't hurt a thing). The anti-jitter features seemed to be in top form with almost no blurriness in any but in the worst lighting conditions.I took this on my train ride to work and shot inside and outside, and got some very nice pictures with the raindrops on the window in sharp focus, and the background scenery quite clear. The IA mode is a pretty good universal choice. I did have some issues shooting some macro shots (a couple of inches away) and experimented with turning the flash totally off. Macro shots seem to work best with no flash. All in all, this is the best "point and shoot" I've ever had for shooting macro type close-ups (e.g., I like to take close-up pictures of butterflies). Off the train and at work I was able to get some very nice shots of tiny screws and wood grain on the desk.My next tests were with the video. The HD is EXCELLENT but it is, as expected, a memory pig. The camera indicated I could shoot a little less than 10 minutes of HD video for the maximum 2 GB file size, or about two separate 10 minute HD videos on the 4 GB chip. The lowest quality setting (320x240) gives over an hour per each 2 GB file. Playback of the video (and all pictures) was more than acceptable, and the quality of both looked the same on my PC's larger monitor. The speaker on the camera is practically worthless (not a deal breaker) but it does exist and if you put your ear real close you can hear the mono sound of your video. On my PC, the sound was loud and clear, but unexceptional. This would not be my first choice as a video camera, but can still be useful for creating short YouTube shoutouts.There are lots of settings possible (having read the manual) but I get a "point and shoot" (like this camera) to avoid complex settings. I'm pretty much going to stick with the IA as my default, and will likely turn the flash completely off in most cases. BUT, if you want to control things, you do have some limited options (read the manual!).I tried the "burst" feature (continual shooting while holding down the shutter button) which was pretty worthless. Since the delay between each shot seemed to be about 2-3 seconds, and there is little control, it's not like you're going be able to shoot supermodels or sporting events with any real clarity. Better to shoot HD video and extract individual frames.Battery life appears to be good, I'm trying to run it down on purpose but it's a new battery so it's holding the initial charge nicely (and with the flash off I'm putting less stress on it). I'm only really comfortable after using a rechargeable battery for a year or so to see how it deteriorates, so I can't comment on this feature with any confidence. Anyway, after about 5 minutes of HD video and about 400 pictures (most without flash) I'm showing half a charge.I didn't try out the included software, but would direct you, in any case, to look for separate reviews on that. I just wanted a "point and shoot" that gives little grief and good pictures (and maybe video) and this suits the bill perfectly.NOTE ADDED (2 HOURS LATER) RE MACRO MODE: I had to wrestle with the whole concept of "macro mode" with this camera. The brief manual that comes with the camera definitely shows a macro mode icon, but that is in IA mode. I just verified that when I put it in IA mode, and place the lens a couple of inches from, say, a leaf, a little "macro mode" icon shows on the LCD display when I press a little down on the shutter button - the autofocus appears to trigger the macro mode in the IA setting. It's just you don't have that as a manual option for macro mode in all the different Scene Mode options - that confused me.

Reviews.Title: Good as a spare camera
Reviews.Author: I. Peters
Reviews.Content: The Lumix DMC-S1 is the second Lumix model I own, my first one being a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Violet).The DMC-S1 is a good basic camera, suitable for beginners or people who do not want to have to read manuals to be able to shoot decent pictures.The Pros:- Size: Very small and thin, perfect for stashing it in a shirt or pant pocket. The lens is flush with the camera body when retracted so nothing protrudes uncomfortably when carrying it.- Price: At under $90 (at the time of this review), this is a very good deal. It makes it the perfect camera for the occasional snapshot or as a second camera for keeping in the car, etc.- MP: The 12.1 Megapixel are more than sufficient for taking decent pictures, especially since megapixels alone are not the deciding factor anyway when it comes to image quality. The S1 takes very nice pictures and at least I cannot see a difference when comparing the images to those of the FH20 which has 14.1 megapixels.- Zoom: The 4x optical zoom is sufficient. I personally like more zoom (the FH20 has an 8x zoom) but I also readily admit that using the full 8x zoom on the FH20 adds a LOT of image noise, so in reality the 4x is probably a better choice, especially if one wants to make (moderate) enlargements and doesn't want to see all the pixelation caused by the 8x zoom.- Macro Mode: While there is no dedicated macro mode, the macro mode is actually built in when in iA. The minimum focus distance in iA is a mere 5 cm (i.e. right about 2 inches), which corresponds to the dedicated macro mode distance of the FH20. One less button to press - this works well for me, especially since I like taking macro pictures and enjoy the convenience of not having to switch to macro mode...- iA mode: One of my favorite features of the Lumix cameras. It is the equivalent to Auto mode on other cameras but Panasonic calls it iA, Intelligent Auto, and I am inclined to agree - the results are usually very nice and keeping the camera in iA should cover most photographic situations a casual photographer encounters.- Image Stabilizer: I remember a time when image stabilizers where something only available in high-end cameras or lenses. Nowadays this is standard in pretty much every camera. But I still think it is a pro worth mentioning in a camera available at such a budget price.- Speed: The S1 is nice and fast, even when the flash was fired.- HD Video: I was pleasantly surprised with the video capability of this little camera. Again: For the price it performed very well. I took a test video in my dark office, blinds closed, no lamps on and the detail captured in it was quite impressive. Also no detectable camera shake - cool. The sound was less impressive and a bit muffled but considering that this is a still camera first and a budget model at that - very well done, Panasonic! Note: Zoom is not available during video recording.- Scene Modes: There are 16 to choose from, amongst them 2 portrait modes, Sports, Landscape, Party, Sunset, Beach, High Sensitivity and Baby. Personally I don't find many of these too, too useful on a day-today basis as these address very specific shooting situations. Then again, since there is no manual mode, these might occasionally come in handy. That largely depends on the individual photographer and his/her preferences...- Additional Functionality: The S1 has the option to display grid lines on the LCD display (useful for shooting architecture or the horizon to make sure the camera is held straight). It has a self-timer option for 2 or 10 seconds delay, the option to turn off the automatic flash, and the ability to adjust exposure. On top of that white balance can be adjusted and the color mode can be selected (options are: Standard, Natural, Vivid, B/W, Sepia, Cool, Warm). The available options vary depending on what mode the camera is set to (iA, Normal Mode, Video, etc).- Nice Touch: Where options can be changed, such as AF mode, Color mode etc., there are simple explanations displayed in a banner at the bottom. Great for becoming familiar with the camera and very handy because one does not need to consult the print manual to find out what a specific mode is for or what a change does.The Cons (if you want to call it that):- Camera Body: While the camera is very suitable for carrying it in a shirt pocket, the plastic surface is extremely slick, and I have almost dropped it on more than one occasion. Due to the streamlined shape, there is nothing the hand can really hold on to. Especially if hands are very dry one must be quite careful not to accidentally let go of it. I strongly advise to always, always put your hand through the supplied strap first in order to prevent damage.- The AF: I had trouble getting the camera to auto-focus on objects with lower contrast, even in broad daylight. This was frustrating and prevented me from taking a number of shots because the S1 simply did not focus on the object I wanted to shoot but on the background or the sides instead, regardless of me trying to adjust camera angle, position, zoom, etc. Note: AF mode can be adjusted in Normal Mode - there are 3 different settings: Single Area, Multiple Area and Face Detection, but this did not have any bearing on the camera's ability to focus in my particular situations.- Exposure: The camera tends to overexpose a bit when outdoors. At first I thought this was due to the sharp contrasts present in bright sunlight but even in light to moderate shade the pictures come out consistently a bit too bright. I saw this in iA and Landscape modes, haven't had the opportunity to test other modes yet. It isn't horribly overexposed, just noticeable, with somewhat washed-out colors in the brighter image areas.Summary:For the price, this model is hard to beat and offers a lot for the dollar. That it has areas where it isn't outstanding - well, every camera has these, those in the higher price ranges are no exception. And when looking at the cost vs. the features I really cannot argue the disadvantages too much at all. The only thing that I consistently dislike every time I pick up this camera is the slickness of the body. To me, it just doesn't feel too good to hold and I wish Panasonic had made the surface a bit "grippier". Since this can lead to easily dropping the camera and damaging it, this is my main point for only giving it 3 stars. If it were available, I would probably give 3.5, based on everything else.I will use the S1 as a backup camera to keep in my purse - the small size makes it ideal for that. All in all I prefer the FH20 and would recommend that one over the S1, provided you can find it at a good price. If, however, price is your main consideration, I am sure the S1 will make you happy, too.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera for certain jobs...
Reviews.Author: eyecore
Reviews.Content: Having used this camera in various conditions for over a week now, its strengths and weaknesses have become pretty apparent...and there are a few of both that depending on your needs, that may sway your purchase one way or another.  Note that I also frequently use a  Fujifilm FinePix Z90 and, most often (for best quality), a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ100.  While I may make comparisons between the two, I'm not going to fault a $100 camera for not taking as crisp of a picture as a $300+ camera.First, for those of you that know exactly what you want (and don't want) in a camera, here are a few things that his does quite well:1.  Very vivid colors of outdoor scenes and natural-light scenes.  The colors are sharp with well defined boundaries and contrast...basically, it takes very nice pictures.2.  Ease of use:  only a couple buttons, no manual needed.  The options that you can select say exactly what they are within the camera menu, so selecting the correct option is easy.3.  Excellent battery life.  Comes with a slim rechargeable battery and charger.  (It's a proprietary battery, but contrary to some belief, this is a benefit.  The battery lasts a LOT longer that AA batteries.  Need extra battery life?  Buy a spare battery and keep it charged.)4.  Slim enough to slip into a pocket.5.  Great optical zoom for a camera of its size.  And with the stabilization it has, I never had a blurry picture when zoomed.6.  The video quality, with good lighting, is quite good.  For me, it's good enough that if I didn't have other cameras that already did the same task, I wouldn't hesitate to use it for important video moments like my martial art belt testing for my son, birthdays, etc.  Videos are in .MOV format.7.  It has a lens cover that opens and closes by itself!  This is something that I wish my Panasonic FZ100 had.  Just some simple protection from dust/mist/whatever to keep the lens spot-free.8.  The "intelligent auto" mode that automatically selects the best settings works great.  You can override it (say, tell it you're taking a picture in bright sun/snow or low light, closeup, etc), but in various testing, the auto mode always picked the correct mode for me anyway.  (As does my other Panasonic...)But, of course, the camera does have some drawbacks, but they may not matter:1.  Difficult one-hand operation if you want to use the zoom.2.  You cannot zoom when recording video.3.  No one-touch video recording.  (You need to pick whether you want to record a picture or a video before pressing the shutter button.  Other - more expensive - cameras usually have a "video" button so you don't have to click through menus.4.  Time to focus + take a picture is a little long.And now the most important drawbacks:1.  Low light pictures are bad.  Really bad.  Combine a low-light, indoor picture with using the zoom, and even though the flash fires, the picture ends up grainy and almost looks like it's black and white, even if the objects are less than 6 feet away.2.  There's a limit on how long you can record video.  And it doesn't depend on anything you can change.  Using a class 10 32GB SDHC card (class 10), the timer says the video can go 8 minutes, 24 seconds.Overall, this is a good camera for its class that I'd only NOT recommend if you plan on taking many low-light, indoor pictures or if you want more options for recording video.  (And if your main intent is to take video, be sure to consider the Kodak PlaySport (Zx3) HD Waterproof Pocket Video Camera (Black).  It takes horrible stills and it's only 5MP, but it's built for video and has more options for it.)  This Panasonic is a much better multi-purpose than the Kodak, and chances are, if you're looking at this, you want a still-photo camera.One last note:  I don't install any extra software, unless it's absolutely required to make things work.  The camera came with a CD that I never put into my machine, and have had no problems transferring pictures and videos.  Used on both XP and Win7.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Georgina L. Sparks
Reviews.Content: What my parents have always said is true with this product: you get what you pay for. For under $100 you are getting a small point and shoot camera. It will fit easily in your pocket or purse and will reliably take decent shots. If that is all you are looking for, you will be satisfied with this camera. It is a good value for under $100!If you are looking for a camera that takes great low-light, super detailed, actions/sports, or close-up pictures this is not the camera that will fill all your needs. In addition, I think this camera feels a little cheap and flimsy, especially compared to nicer Lumix camera in the same line. On the plus side, it's super light and portable.I recommend this camera for young adults or casual picture takers. I use this camera to take pictures to post to my blog. It works perfectly well and easy to bring along with me.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: cs
Reviews.Content: A great camera for an average user.Super easy to use in the Intelligent Auto mode - just point-n-shoot and the camera will do the rest.It automatically selects the most appropriate setting under the conditions, including the macro mode.The plastic body is light and slim, with nicely finished details.The control buttons are logically placed.The menu is easy to navigate, with just the basic settings present. Which is a plus for an average user who just leaves the camera in the auto mode anyways and never bothers with the myriad of the advanced settings of the more expensive cameras.The video quality is very nice for such a bargain-priced model.

Reviews.Title: Perfect companion to my superzoom
Reviews.Author: M. Smallwood
Reviews.Content: This is my third Panasonic digicam. My first was a Panasonic Lumix DMC-LZ2 5MP Digital Camera with 6x Image Stabilized Optical Zoom (Silver). It still works, but it has been replaced long ago by other cameras. My current main camera is a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ35 12.1MP Digital Camera with 18x POWER Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD. I purchased this camera with the intent of training my wife to use it because she doesn't like the numerous dials and options on the other cameras in the home. I also intended on carrying it places I wouldn't take my FZ35 due to bulk or danger to it.I have taken approximately 150 shots with the S1 now. There have been a few occasions where I have missed the extra zoom capability of the FZ35, and the performance is not nearly up to par with that camera in terms of shot to shot speed or photo quality. By the same token, this camera blows away the camera on my Samsung Transform Android Phone (Sprint). For the size of the camera and the price, I am blown away by the photos I have been able to capture.The camera fits effortlessly into a shirt, coat, or jean pocket. It also seems capable of taking a fair amount of incidental wear. The lens does not protrude too far from the body, and it is quite small. I paired this camera with a $1 camera case I found locally and won't worry too much about wear or damage.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the Price. Perfect point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: M. Apodaca
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mom for her birthday and my mom is not technically savvy by any means. Before this camera she was still using the disposable cameras if that tells you anything.  She was going on a cruise so I wanted her to have a good point and shoot camera and this one was great. Right out of the box, it was easy to set up, program the date and time, and the pictures are clear and crisp and have great color. I purchased an 8gb memory card for it and that gave her the ability to take 900+ pics.  The camera styling is very nice, small, light and sleek. The only thing I didn't like was that this camera didn't come with any kind of case but that is an easy and cheap fix. I would reccomend this camera for someone looking for a simple point and shoot at a great price. I got the camera and the memory card for under $100 with free shipping!  Can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Good, lightweight camera
Reviews.Author: R. Madrigal
Reviews.Content: So far I like this camera.  I bought it to take on a trip.  it is holding up good.  Takes much better pictures than the Canon camera I bought in the same price range.  I took the Canon back to Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: too easy to use?
Reviews.Author: Diana D. Carr
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a friend.  He has been using it so much that it may prove injurious to his health (some people do not like their pictures).  In spite of the owners manual being bigger than the camera, he figured it out quickly and has been taking nice clear pictures ever since.

Reviews.Title: Really cool digital camera
Reviews.Author: Siva
Reviews.Content: I bought it from woot through Amazon. It's really having a stylish design and giving good pictures with 12.1 mpx.

Reviews.Title: A disappointing Panasonic, which is a first for me
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I love Panasonic cameras, having owned 5 of them now, but this one was VERY disappointing. This was intended to be just a good inexpensive camera to carry around in my bag, but it's too cheap-feeling for even light-duty use. Shiny, slick plastic, hard to grip, the lens motor sounded weak so I fear it wouldn't last long - and it also made strange noises now and then when turning the camera on. Defective camera?  Maybe, but I'm positive a cheap motor is used in this camera, and I didn't want to chance it. The battery/SD card cover was super-flimsy and wouldn't take much use for it to break.I didn't bother trying this S1 out for a few days before deciding - the few pictures I took using the iA setting were not up to par with my other cameras, not even my older Panasonic cameras from the 2007-2008 era.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Baker "kairilily"
Reviews.Content: So far, I'm loving this camera!  I'm not a professional photographer or even an enthusiast, but I love to take pictures of my kids.  The two cameras I've used prior to this (and still own) annoy me because they seem to hesitate when I push the button to take the picture.  That's caused me to miss out on some very nice shots.  This camera doesn't do that to me!  As soon as I push the button, it takes the picture.  I also like the small size.  It fits nicely in the palm of one hand.  This allowed me to take lots of pictures at the local amusement park yesterday while still holding a tote bag full of stuff in the other hand.So far all of the pictures I've taken with this camera have came out clear except for two.  That's great considering how many blurry photos I usually end up with.  Even the action shots from the amusement park turned out nicely. If I had the ability to post some of the photos I took, I would.Basically, if you're an amateur like myself, I think this is a nice camera for the price.  It takes beautiful, clear pictures and that's all I ask for in a camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value as a entry level / kids camera - marred by poor battery life and ambiguous mode switching...
Reviews.Author: Y. R. Wu "The will to win is nothing without ...
Reviews.Content: Summary: Entry level point and shoot at a very reasonable price takes high quality pictures and video - most of the time.  Some functional issues that you have to get used to. Most of these are likely attributable to compromises needed to give this camera it's tiny size.This quickly became my wife's camera, replacing our Canon A570IS point and shoot.  We've taken several hundred pictures already (more on that later) and it's now the primary P&S; (We also have a digital SLR).  It's smaller than the average cell phone and the smooth black finish look and feel very expensive.  Perfect for a purse or even shirt pocket.  Of course, the key question is: does it take good pictures?The short answer is - most of the time.  For still shots the image stabilization and IA (intelligent Auto) mode do a good job of focusing when and where you want it to, but the problem is the flash and low light performance.  In particular I use the flash almost all the time - even in daylight I will use a fill flash to soften shadows on faces.  The flash on this camera is amazingly small and not surprisingly does not perform.  The unfortunate part is that the low light performane is also marginal.  I'm accustomed to the performance of our SLR but indoor no flash shots show more grain than our 7 megapixel Canon.Delay to first shot is a marginal 2-3 seconds, in between shots is yet another 3-4-5-6 seconds depending on whether you're waiting for the flash to charge up.  Burst mode?  not really.For Video, it shoots in HD and although there is no zoom it appears like there might actually be image stabilization.  Colors are suprisingly vivid and overall, comparable to the quality of various flip type cameras.  Unfortunately, although the video quality is comparable, getting to the video mode and the overall ergonomics are definitely lacking.  Part of this is that changing modes is a bit confusing.  There are several buttons that allow you to exit the mode changing menu - however only one button actually changes the mode so if you are shooting a video and want to switch modes - better pay attention.  It would be really nice if they had a dedicated video button, or barring that, an easier way than 5 button presses to shoot video.Finally, battery life is a problem.  Our 8 year old has adopted this and shoots non stop.  The battery from a fresh charge will run out before you fill a 4 Gb SD card.I'd say we honestly think it is a decent value at the street price (although we received it through Vine) however if I were to be in the market for a comparable camera, I'd first check competitive reviews for flash and battery performance.If you have any questions, comments, or if you found this review helpful, please let me know!

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Mura
Reviews.Content: I used it for the first time. its good in the basic models. price worthy. light weight.easy to use.battery life is poor.

Reviews.Title: Nice, simple basic camera
Reviews.Author: K. Swanson
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this one short and sweet, as Messieurs Gagarin and Peters have written about it here well and at much length. I have a number of basic point and shoot cameras, and my favorites are still the Canons. But this little Panasonic is a very functional camera at a fair price, and takes crisp shots with nice color saturation.I wasn't blown away by the video features, and don't really see it as a vid camera except for rare occasions when it's all you've got room for. But as a nice basic point and shoot camera, it's excellent, and its auto function does indeed adjust well to all situations I've tried, night and day. 12 mps is plenty unless you're blowing up your photos to four feet square, by the way.If you need a good simple camera that does most of the work for you, and would like the occasional video from it as well, this will do nicely (but for video you'll need at least a 16gb SDHC card, so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: J. Capobianco
Reviews.Content: I collect cameras and got this on Ebay for $20 with battery. I am VERY surprised at the quality of the pics with this camera.Mine is sharp center to edge and sharpness hold up well even at 112mm. It is a slow lens so flash distance is limited but everything else (including the HD video) is great. Has less grain noise than previous Lumix cameras due to updated Venus processor.

Reviews.Title: inexpensive camera for knock around trips
Reviews.Author: skiarc
Reviews.Content: I've got a Panasonic Lumix LX5 that I really like it is the best point in shoot I own.  That said it is a little larger than most compact cameras and a bit more spendy.  So when I started putting together a trip to Thailand where we were traveling light and fast I didn't want my nice LX5.  So I brought the DMC-S1.  It took fine pictures, not as sharp and vivid as the LX5 but adequate for the normal pictures we exchange via email and thumbnails on facebook.I'd recommend this camera for someone looking for a good camera in that lower price range.  It definitely has that plastic-y feel to it, but it may surprise you.  It did me.

Reviews.Title: LCD inadequate outside, image stabilization good for person with a tremor
Reviews.Author: Raquelita
Reviews.Content: Lightweight beginner camera but looks as if I will only be able to take pictures outside in early morning or at dusk. In bright sunlight the LCD reflects my shirt.Bought it for the good image stabilization but will probably return it. I wonder why other reviewers haven't commented on the LCD problem except for one who mentioned the "tight viewing angle." This is the first camera I have had without an optical viewfinder so I didn't anticipate the problem.

Reviews.Title: I've purchase 2 of these
Reviews.Author: Sandra Mom of 2.
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras (one pink and one blue). The first one was for my 10 year old and then my 13 year old wanted one too.  It has very good quality pictures.  Much better than the kids could take on their IPODs.  A memory card is a must.  We have had very good luck with this little camera.  My kids have taken it on vacations, tossed it around car and under bed etc and it has held up.  Very easy to use, easily packs in purse or pocket.

Reviews.Title: My best camera so far!
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera! So glad I found it on Amazon. It is simplified and doesn't have all the buttons/knobs that go unused. Perfect for me! Takes great pics!!!

Reviews.Title: Kid's camewrs
Reviews.Author: A. Fattahi "Bakerman"
Reviews.Content: I already had a luminex S53 which I love.  I bought this for my daughter.  She wanted a blue color camera!  This is more of a toy camera.  Not very good picture quality or features.  Spend a little extra and get a higher model Luminex.

Reviews.Title: LUMIX
Reviews.Author: chief
Reviews.Content: Great price and seems to work well so far. Battery lasts long time. And i have had good luck with Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: an unbelieveable camera
Reviews.Author: bracha
Reviews.Content: the Lumix series of Panasonic is the best cameras I used, I'm using 3 cameras of this series and I'm very setisfied, it's easy to use, make clear pictures, and nice videos.one thing I'm not happy that I can't make zoom with videos.

Reviews.Title: Nice pocket sized camera!
Reviews.Author: Kamsmommy
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and carry with you for the pictures you may miss when you don't want to lug around your bigger cameras. I always have this camera in my pocketbook for the quick shot.  It is a simple camera with nothing fancy but takes good pictures.  The camera has held up well, is lightweight, and takes a decent picture.  If you subject is moving it does not take a good picture!! So for active little children it might not be the best camera.  Overall I would recommend this camera as a good point and shoot that is easy to carry. I would not recommend this as your main digital camera however since it is very basic with a small zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Creator555
Reviews.Content: This is the second camera of this model I purchased: first was for 11-year old, who was able to figure it out easily and is capturing some remarkable photos. Second purchase was for a old-fashioned film photographer (o.k., a Luddite...) who has no clue about new stuff.  He's learning the features and is able to do the basics so far.  If he gets stuck, he just uses automatic. It's all about finding out where things are, and the menu is pretty basic and access to various physical controls is easy.  He's off to FL with his new camera, so we'll see what he comes back with.  (Since there are usually a lot of bright light shooting situations there, he may wish for a bit better result, as this camera tends to wash out in extreme sunlight, but the manual exposure feature is there for him when he learns it.) We bought a high speed media card for him to shoot video at Daytona Beach Speedway so that should be an excellent test of the video feature.There is a lot of capability built-in to this little camera and once again Panasonic does a good job.UPDATE: 6/23/2012, hubby and camera back from FL...outstanding pictures even in the sun! Beach pictures and spectacular skies, exposure all great. The Daytona Beach video, alas, never happened; they don't allow personal cameras on your ride in the racecar, but the other video at the speedway is great! I like the fact you can download a still shot from a video. Cover your bases and be sure you get the shot you want! At this price, how can you lose?

Reviews.Title: Exellent  camera Best for Price
Reviews.Author: Rafael Cermeño
Reviews.Content: Buy it on sale, is a very basic acamara in all aspects of high quality but with some focus issues but nothing that can not calm arreglarcelas to take a good photo, I seems it for $ 50 you pay what you pay received .

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!  Price was also very good.  Easy to use while producing great pictures.  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great, for what it is
Reviews.Author: A. Gift For You "ATL G"
Reviews.Content: 12 MP, 4X zoom and Amazon $50.00 Gold Box deal, there are none better.  Had a new Fuji FinePix and cannot stand to use it.  Am a Canon snob, but Panasonic Lumix might just change that game

Reviews.Title: As good as you can expect for a camera in this price range
Reviews.Author: Peachbulb
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a year now and have used it in many situations, and here are my thoughts.The camera is extremely lightweight. I carry it in my purse all the time because it's so light. Although there is a camera on my phone, this camera is way better and doesn't add weight to my purse. The battery life is phenomenal. Some people have mentioned that their battery doesn't last that long, so perhaps I got lucky. Anyway, I've taken hundreds of photos and movies, and I've only had to charge it a few times. Sometimes it sits in my purse a long time without being used, and the battery doesn't seem to have drained during that time. As others have mentioned, the video quality is excellent for any camera, but especially for one this size and price range.As you'd expect for a camera this size and price range, the picture quality isn't phenomenal, especially in low light. The flash is weak and has a weak range, which I think contributes to the camera having problems focusing sometimes in low light.Overall, you can't expect SLR quality photos with a camera this size and price range, and you don't get them either. The image quality is as good as you can expect, and the video quality is far better than I expected. But if you want great pictures, especially in low light, you'll have to shell out more.Full disclosure: I received a free test model of the camera to review but was not otherwise compensated.

Reviews.Title: Good investment
Reviews.Author: Abigailbarnes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an old Kodak that had quit working.  I am very pleased with it's performance.  Lots of good features not available on the Kodak that make it a very user friendly camera.  Works great! Nice clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: Simple, basic point and shoot with image stabilization
Reviews.Author: Comdet
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic point and shoot. It won't stand up to demanding photo needs, but works well for everyday snapshots.  The controls are easy to use and the viewfinder is large and clear.One of the problems I've had with point and shoots is that they are sometimes too small to actually use. This strikes a nice balance - it's small enough to fit easily into a pocket, but not so small that I find it hard to use.There are a lot of decent choices for the under $100 point and shoots, but what drew me to this model was the fact that it has image stabilization. That's a very nice feature to have, and one that is often reserved for models further up in the camera food chain.I got this mainly for taking quick photos when I don't want to bother with something more involved, and for taking with me on outings when I don't want to worry about damaging an expensive piece of gear. Just toss this into my bag and go.  As such, it satisfies those needs very well, and produces more than good enough photos.It would also make a great choice for a first camera for someone who is just starting off in photography.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: small, compact & easy to use
Reviews.Author: Charles Coffey "Decorah Lion"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife who wanted a small camera that she could take anywhere and that was very easy to use. She didn't want to climb a steep learner's curve. This was our first Panasonic camera & our 3rd digital camera. This camera is very easy to use. In about 5 minutes you can, without a manual, figure out how to do everything this camera can do just playing with the buttons. A second strength is its small size. You can easily put it in your shirt pocket or whatever. Because of its small size, you need to use the included strap or you will drop it.I found the picture quality adequate in most cases. You can us it as on IA (intelligent automatic) or pick specific scene types. Either is easy to do.The LCD display shows the ISO, shutter speed & F stop as you compose your picture. The LCD is really pretty good for composing your shots.The video quality was surprisingly good, 720P. The audio quality is poor. I would use the video only when the sound is not really important or you will be disappointed.Another reviewer said the flash was good only to about 2 meters. It was my impression the flash is adequate and will go out a little further than than.The included battery charger worked well and was again easy to use. No big surprises or problems with this. The macro function on this camera exceeded my expectations. The self timer works well and was very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Loves to read
Reviews.Content: I bought this item as a Christmas gift for my daughter in law and she just received it .  She seemed pleased with it.  The camera arrived right away so the delivery was excellent.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Roy Bonilla
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good, it have excellent photo quality and the optical image stabilized is very good, the design is good and very comfortable. I'm very  happy.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix Camera
Reviews.Author: Priscilla K. Stockner "history seeker"
Reviews.Content: Camera came on time and was exactly as describes. It was a little heard to program but now is working very satisfactorily.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a replacement for my mom (who has a terrible one right now).  I played around with it a bit and it takes great photos (better than the more expensive fujufilm I have) and is great for someone who is not very good at taking pictures (like mom).  It is light and small, which is nice.  I do wish it were a little heavier, as the camera feels a little cheap to me.  All in all, it takes good pictures and is definitely worth the price, I am excited to give it to mom for Christmas!

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD FOR A POINT AND SHOOT
Reviews.Author: Kapado
Reviews.Content: high detail , it does its job well , makes me be embarrassed of my 5.0 cellphone camera ,but thats why i got this , love the flash too although its not that strong at night at long distances as expected.but the image quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for such a low price
Reviews.Author: cweisens
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 6 year old granddaughter.  She had the plastic toy camera that she enjoyed, but I felt it was time to get a real camera.  I really didn't expect much for $69, but it certainly turned out to be a good value.The feel is quite cheap and plasticky, even though it looks good.  I hope it holds up to a little abuse.  I like that there are not a lot of dials and choices.  It is very basic.I was very pleasantly surprised by the photo quality.  I downloaded and printed several pictures, and they were passable.  Even the video was pretty good.  I personally use a Nikon D90 and a Lumix LX5, so I am used to exceptional picture quality.  While I would not use the S1 for my personal use, I think that it will be a perfect choice for my granddaughter.I gave it 4 stars compared to other inexpensive P and S cameras.

Reviews.Title: Okay Camera for a Beginner
Reviews.Author: K. Groh
Reviews.Content: I've had Panasonic Lumix cameras in the past and have loved them. This one is not really up to par but is offered at one third of the price so I wouldn't expect it to be of the same quality.It is very light and the case is made of a very lightweight plastic which unfortunately gives it a very cheap feel. The zoom is okay but it has trouble focusing on anything from about 20". The pictures are basic, not a ton of detail but okay for a beginner's camera.I am a little tainted in that we purchased a nice Polaroid t1031 10.0 MP Digital Still Camera with 3.0 LCD Display (Orange) over a year ago for $65 which takes better pictures and has a sturdier metal camera body.This is an okay camera for a child since it has few settings and takes video as well. The built-in memory is convenient too and holds more than just a couple of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Solid Little Inexpensive Camera
Reviews.Author: Talvi
Reviews.Content: I chose this for my 8 year old - the cost was right so that if she ended up breaking it, I wouldn't feel too bad.  The camera takes great pictures, is small and lightweight, and it is very easy to use.  She was up and using it within minutes of charging the battery.The images were decent, LCD crisp and clean, operation fast, and we were happy with the quality of the videos.  In all, this was the perfect inexpensive yet decent camera to carry around and capture family memories (or let the 8 year old explore macros and portraits).

Reviews.Title: Not so very good.......
Reviews.Author: PedalTweaker
Reviews.Content: I was just looking for a cheap point and shoot camera when I got stumbled to a mall store representative who presented me this Panasonic Lumix S1. At first I was impressed how this digital camera took pictures when I tried on the store. I thought the flash was also good because I took pictures of a distant object inside the store. Somehow the picture was acceptable to my taste. But as soon I get used in using this gadget, I found out what's this digital camera's flaws were. Like most digital camera at this price range, the flash is inadequate. Second, the picture quality is inconsistent even w/ the flash on the automatic mode. It's dependent on lighting source. The worst part of this camera based on my experience was that picture quality of some pictures would look nice and crisp on the LCD screen but when you transferred it the PC, some shots were grainy. But I was able to experiment this camera and tried some settings that I thought would maiximize it's potential and got some good quality shots. For the price what could I expect. There must be some better brand than this camera in terms of picture quality and features within the price range.

Reviews.Title: Broken Right Out Of The Box
Reviews.Author: Damita Syn
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera specifically for a vacation I took and was extremely disappointed to find that it was broken right out of the box. The LCD screen was damaged rendering the camera unusable. I would not buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera at all.
Reviews.Author: dragswarup
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few hours ago, as a gift for someone. I thought of giving it a try , so I opened it up and clicked a few shots. I was surprised to see such bad quality pics. I tried to change all kind of settings and ISO values too, but the pics were no good . So much noise , and that too in good lighting conditions, both  on auto ISO and ISO 100. Very disappointed, returning it back the first thing in the morning. Of course it's not my 1st camera , and I have got way better results from other cameras of same or even much less megapixels.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, BUT.......
Reviews.Author: New Bride "trsgirl"
Reviews.Content: Okay I will admit I have only had it for 2 days now.First and foremost, if you plan on actually loading the pics into your pc, STOP. Can you use it if the cord is 23 1/2" long? From tip of USB plug to end that inserts in the camera. I HAVE a front USB jack and I cannot set it on my desk.SHEESH.My main PC with jacks in the back--nope, can't use it. AT ALL. So I have to use the spare one, and that's not the one I NEEDED IT FOR.That's like having a vacuum with a five foot cord.And second, maybe most importantly, the battery.Whomever said it has a long life is totally wrong. Charged it right out of the box til the light went out. Used it to take two pics, load them into the PC. Walked away and literally ten minutes later it's beeping-the battery is DEAD. There is NO WAY to charge it other than to remove it from the camera. It doesn't fit my printer dock, so........ It arrived Saturday evening, so I've had this battery in it for about 26 hours.Since I haven't acquired (why the heck do I need this, I thought) an EXTRA battery at my own expense, I "get" to wait another 3 hours to charge it. Good thing I'm not using it at work, I would "get" to go home for the day.This camera is very likely going back as a return. For any purpose other than occasional "FUN" it's not functional.Sorry Panasonic, I love most of your stuff, but this camera (even with the great photos and wonderful features) is worthless to me.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: LittleMighty "LittleMighty"
Reviews.Content: I used to have a 5.0mp Kodak easy share. The Lumix, even with a 12.1 mp, is NO COMPARISON. The flash is worthless, making any pictures taken more then 2 feet from the subject dark and blurry. The delay is so long if you are taking pictures of anything besides a tree its usually out of the frame before the picture is taken. I don't recommend this to any one. Even with extenisive editing I can't get any of the photos I take with this camera too look even fairly decent. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, for the price
Reviews.Author: Kula
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a few weeks now, so I have been able to use it in all sort of conditions.I have found that indoors in low light it preforms about as well as you would think an inexpensive camera would perform -- the pictures are sort of dark and grainy. The flash tends to wash out images in the picture, but is a good alternative to grainy shots. Outside, the pictures are colorful and vibrant. Just like with most point and shoots, they perform best outdoors when there is not a need for flash.At my work we are always taking pictures and so we have a lot of cameras. I have used most of the more inexpensive point and shoots out there and right now we use the Canon PowerShot A3000IS. It is a great camera but not so great for indoor shots without the flash. I would say this Panasonic out preforms the Canon in indoor conditions, but is pretty comparable with outdoor shots.I love the size and weight of this camera, very light making it very portable.All in all, I think this a great camera for the low price of $90. If you are looking for a camera with better quality pictures, and more options this is not for you. If you would like an inexpensive camera to capture quick shots then I think you have found your camera.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my camera.
Reviews.Author: Miriam Monterola
Reviews.Content: Good AfternoonI got amazon page in internet, I open this page, I request about this page to a friend of mine that travel to USA and he said that good for buying it very responsably, so I live en Venezuela, I buy here and my freind bring to me when he return.  All my buing have been good, nice, i like it.  Thank you very much.Very truly yourMiriam Monterola

Reviews.Title: camera fun
Reviews.Author: J. Lewis
Reviews.Content: This panasonic camera was sent as birthday gift, so I have not personally used it.  However, from all reports, it is a great little pocket camera, takes good pics. I chose it as I have confidence in the panasonic name, represents quality, had good customer reviews, good price.  I have a panasonic lumix dmc-fh20 camera of my own as well, also ordered through Amazon.  I am very happy w/ all aspects/features of it, picture quality, shutter speed,multiple options/settings,video, battery life. I would recommend both cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good camera and exvcellent price
Reviews.Author: Moises Porras "Moises Porras Gamboa"
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent adquisition, is a really good camera and I got it for an excellent price.You need to buy the memory and the case since this offert dont have it.Good picture, excellent quality, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift.  Good pictures and price.
Reviews.Author: Kevin Swad
Reviews.Content: This camera is great if you are looking for a simple point-and-shoot camera that takes great pictures.  Great camera to take when you're going to places and want something light to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: great for all ages
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old was ready for a real camera, and my wife doesn't like my cluncky DSLR so much, this is a very nice camera easy enough for the youngsters to use and high quality that an adult expects. Some features to look for that this one has are digital zoom and image stabilization.

Reviews.Title: simple and great product
Reviews.Author: commoner
Reviews.Content: It's a great simple camera to use and light weight. I like it very much. It's simple to understand and use. Easy to carry everywhere. Takes great picture.

Reviews.Title: you will get what you paid for
Reviews.Author: newbie
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like the product because of the low price (I got it from lightning deal for $69) but it is much below my expectation. Note that this review is only based on my short experience before I return it.I ordered this product since I like the color of the pictures taken by Lumix cameras. When I power on the camera, the lens was coming out while making buzzing noises; it buzzes also when retracting. Zooming speed is also really really slow although it is only 4X zoom (it buzzes also when zooming). In addition, the LCD is really terrible. It has 250k pixels but it is really really low quality. Images on the screen are really blurred like noise filtered. I have another camera from Kodak with the same pixel LCD screen, but its LCD is much better than this.If you need a cheap camera and don't bother about the noises and terrible LCD, this camera would be right for you.

Reviews.Title: Very nice basic camera - perfect for on the go use
Reviews.Author: AlexJouJou
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to trying this camera - and it did not disappoint. This is a very nice camera for those who want a point and click without complicated features. It does fantastic at outdoor shots and the indoor ones are very good indeed. It is not difficult to learn how to use, hooks up easily to my laptop, and is a nice size to put in a pocket.It doesn't feel like the highest quality camera but for this price I don't think you can expect that. I like the size of the screen and the pictures look like how they look on the screen.I think it is perfect for teens, non tech folks who don't need a high end camera, anyone going on vacation where you just want to be able to snap photo's (and not do a photo shoot!), and for those who want to keep an everyday camera around to grab when the need arises. The quality is higher than a cell phone camera though the video sound quality is particularly poor (so don't use it for that).Edited to add: I've now been using this for well over 2 months. I switched coasts and have taken a lot of new pictures as I explore my new neighborhood (love DC!) and this camera continues to perform very well. I have had no issues, the battery stays charged quite well, and the pictures translate nicely to places like facebook. The fact that it is nicely portable and not heavy is also helpful when you do a lot of walking. Happy Photo'ing!

Reviews.Title: love it but...
Reviews.Author: Sonia Gamboa Alvarado "Sonilu"
Reviews.Content: I love the camera, it's been working fine But the only problem is that when you turn it on is going to give you a reminder about the underwater protection, so that can be annoying.But everything else is perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: guala's toy camera
Reviews.Author: Laura G. D. Guzman "guala"
Reviews.Content: love the Panasonic line, and i needed a everyday camera to have in my purse , and my bulky more profesional cameras won't do because of space and care they need, so this camera was on sale and i decided to give it a try, the truth is i did not like it very much...it's body seems like it will fall apart any time, and when you turn it on, it makes this awful noise.. its scary! it really feels and sounds like a toy camera.... PERFORMANCE... ok but  2 buttons on top, the on/off and the shoot,without more quick shooting options, i think this camera would be present for your 12 year old niece as a first real camera ,not what i expected, not returning it though... because the truth is, it was really really cheap! ...so i'm giving it...to my 14 year old niece!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Marissa Wolf
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, I bought it as a lightning deal and it is well worth the money. Them camera is simple to use and takesl good pictures, I gave it 4 stars only because it does not take movies, which I knew when I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Erich Maria Remarque
Reviews.Content: Objects that are red in real life appear as orange in photographs taken with this camera. I tried it side by side with a Fujifilm FinePix J28 (another compact P&S; camera), and the J28 takes more lifelike pictures. I will try to upload some comparison shots later.I tried playing with the settings, but I simply couldn't get the colors (the color red in particular) to appear right. It always appears a little lighter than it should be (orangish). Yet in some case the colors in general are darker than they should be (poor flash maybe?). This isn't too noticeable until you compare the actual object with the picture (or compare pictures taken with this camera with pictures taken with other cameras).It does shoot decent video though. Not as good as Flip camcorders or my Canon SX130 camera, but definitely better than the Fuji J28.Overall, I don't think I'll be using this camera for special events.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Me, An Amateur
Reviews.Author: Conspicuous Consumer
Reviews.Content: (Reviewed by friend of Conspicuous Consumer)I broke in my LUMIX S1 camera this week at Vacation Bible School.  The sleek design fit nicely in my hand as I was taking quick shots of rapidly moving children, as well as video.  The quality of the video is so good that our media person is using it to make a montage of the week's videos for the final program, and promotion for next year!  Various modes allow for quick programming for a perfect shot.  Love the zoom.  Very user-friendly and I look forward to using it for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Amateurs!
Reviews.Author: GLBT
Reviews.Content: I got the Panasonic Lumix DMC-S1 12.1 MP Digital Camera for my wife and she LOVES it! It's compact, sleek, and stylish.. which, I'm not sure why that matters for a camera, but apparently it does. More importantly, it's got all sorts of nifty features. For example, it somehow compensates for unsteady hands so even if the person taking the picture isn't completely still, the picture doesn't have that shaky/blurry quality.Easy to use, very light-weight, and the results look very professional!

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Jose Geraldino
Reviews.Content: Most of the photos that I take with the camera are blury if the room is dark.The camera audio speakers are worthless.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Little Digital Camera. But...
Reviews.Author: thornhillatthemovies.com
Reviews.Content: I own a Canon Powershot and I love it. Their are two reasons I picked it. It is a Canon and it has a shape similar to that of a traditional SLR. When I was looking at digital cameras, some were so small I was afraid I would lose them, drop them, have them fall between sidewalk grfates, etc. The Canon Powershot has been with me for a number of years and provided me with many photos from family functions and world travels. It is also extremely easy to use.When I saw this camera offered on Amazon Vine, I thought I would give it a try.It has a nice shape and seems to take nice pictures. I don't have the expertise to compare pixels and picture size and all of the other things I have seen people really disect in their revies of cameras.What I can tell you is that the interface on the camera is not the greatest. Once you make a selection, it is difficult to go backwards. For a while, I was simply turning the camera off and then back on to change from Portrait to Landscape from instance. I have since figured out that you can go back and make changes, but it is nowhere near as user friendly as the Powershot.Also, in order to take the HD video, you need a different kind of SD card, the card I have will allow it to take pictures, but I need to upgrade it to take video.

Reviews.Title: Decent cheap camera
Reviews.Author: Stephan Nance
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty inexpensive digital camera, and I'd say you get your money's worth. Upon taking it out of the box, I was a little surprised at how chintzy it seemed. But then I was more surprised at the relatively high quality of the pictures it takes.Up close, anyway. The zoom isn't anything to write home about. Also, there is no memory card included, and the camera itself has only limited storage space (just room for a handful of high-quality pictures).Overall, I think this could be a good first camera for a kid who maybe isn't quite ready for one that would require more of an investment.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel resolution; 4x optical image-stablized zoom
720p HD video capture at 30fps
Panasonic iA mode makes it simple for anyone to take beautiful photos
LUMIX Image Uploader makes it simple to share pictures on Facebook and video on YouTube
Capture images and video to  SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-S1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Gold)
